definition[0]: someone or something that is beautiful is extremely attractive to look at
example[0]: She was even more beautiful than I had remembered.
definition[1]: very good or giving you great pleasure
definition[2]: a beautiful woman or child has perfect good looks
example[7]: Grace Kelly was a very beautiful woman.
definition[3]: a good-looking person looks nice. Good-looking is very common in spoken English
example[9]: He’s a good-looking guy, but he’s a bit boring.
definition[4]: an attractive person looks nice, especially in a way that makes you feel sexually interested in them
example[12]: A lot of women find him attractive.
definition[5]: a pretty girl or woman looks nice – used especially about a woman who has a nice face
example[13]: You look pretty with your hair down.
example[14]: She has a very pretty face.
definition[6]: a handsome man or boy looks nice – used especially about a man who has a nice face. Handsome is also sometimes used, especially in literature, to describe a woman who is good-looking and has a strong face
example[15]: He was tall, dark, and handsome.
example[16]: She was a big, handsome woman.
definition[7]: extremely attractive. Gorgeous is used especially by women
example[17]: She thinks Brad Pitt is gorgeous.
example[18]: You look absolutely stunning in that dress!
definition[8]: nice to look at – used about animals, babies, children, and young adults
definition[9]: used when saying that someone looks very nice
definition[10]: used to describe something that looks, feels, sounds etc so good that it gives you a lot of pleasure
definition[11]: used when saying that something looks, feels, or sounds very nice
definition[12]: pleasant to look at – often used about things that are not big or impressive
definition[13]: pleasant to look at. Attractive sounds more formal than pretty
example[29]: an attractive white-painted cottage with green shutters
definition[14]: very big, beautiful, and impressive – used about buildings, objects, and views
example[31]: The Taj Mahal always looks magnificent.
example[33]: There were magnificent views over the old city.
definition[15]: pleasant to look at – used in written descriptions of towns, buildings, and places
example[34]: the picturesque harbour town of Castleton
example[35]: Regensburg Cathedral occupies a picturesque position on the River Danube in Bavaria.
definition[16]: extremely beautiful and impressive – used especially about views
example[36]: All around is a stunning view of Cape Town.
definition[17]: used to describe things that have very beautiful small details, especially things that have been made with a lot of skill
example[40]: an exquisite picture of a bird of paradise
definition[18]: designed in a way that looks very attractive and has a lot of style
